description: Common medical suffixes that modify the meaning of terms

questions.question: What does the suffix '-itis' mean?
questions.explanation: -itis indicates inflammation of a body part or tissue

questions.question: If a patient had a 'cholecystectomy,' what does the '-ectomy' suffix tell you happened?
questions.explanation: -ectomy means surgical removal, so cholecystectomy is the removal of the gallbladder

questions.question: What does 'neuralgia' mean based on the suffix '-algia'?
questions.explanation: -algia means pain, so neuralgia indicates nerve pain

questions.question: If a patient has 'anemia,' what does the '-emia' suffix indicate?
What medical specialty would study diseases of the skin, based on the suffix '-logy'?
questions.explanation: -logy means the study of, so dermatology is the study of skin
